author: Noemie Bisserbe
title: Shire to Sell Oncology Unit for $2.4 Billion as Takeda Mulls Takeover
text:
Shire PLC has agreed to sell its oncology business to French drugmaker Servier for $2.4 billion, in a deal that could discourage Japanâ€™s Takeda Pharmaceutical Co. from launching a takeover of the London-listed company.
Takeda said in March it was considering a bid for Shire and identified its oncology business as one of the main reasons for its interest. A pursuit of Shire would be one of the biggest attempts by a Japanese company to buy a Western rival.
...
